citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At approximately 1pm on January 1st, 2024, an 8-year old intact male Red Kangaroo, "Sprocket" was found recumbent in
his outdoor shelter, cold and not moving, though responsive. The animal care staff immediately moved Sprocket to a
warmer area where he was offered water, monitored and allowed to warm up. Sprocket subsequently passed away that
early evening without veterinary medical attention. Regarding seeking emergency medical attention, the facility
representatives stated that being with it being New Year's Day, their veterinarian was closed and they did not call around
seeking emergency care. They stated that they were planning to call their veterinarian as soon as offices were open the
following day. The program of veterinary care must establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that
include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose and treat diseases and injuries, and the availability of
emergency, weekend, and holiday care. Having emergency contacts are crucial to the animals receiving timely veterinary
care in the event of an emergency on a holiday.
***Correct from 1/16/24 going forward
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Critical
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
At approximately 1pm on January 1st, 2024, an 8-year old intact male Red Kangaroo, "Sprocket" was found recumbent in 
his outdoor shelter, cold and not moving, though responsive. The animal care staff immediately moved Sprocket to a 
warmer area where he was offered water, monitored and allowed to warm up. Sprocket subsequently passed away that 
early evening without veterinary medical attention. Regarding seeking emergency medical attention, the facility 
representatives stated that being with it being New Year's Day, their veterinarian was closed and they did not call around 
seeking emergency care. They stated that they were planning to call their veterinarian as soon as offices were open the 
following day. The program of veterinary care must establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that 
include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose and treat diseases and injuries, and the availability of 
emergency, weekend, and holiday care. Having emergency contacts are crucial to the animals receiving timely veterinary 
care in the event of an emergency on a holiday.  
 
***Correct from 1/16/24 going forward 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
